text.p: Anglo-Dutch combine Unilever Group said on Friday that its recent signing of an advertising contract with TV Azteca did not entail breaking relations with rival Grupo Televisa SA de CV.

"The agreement with TV Azteca entails no break with Televisa, a company with which Unilever has held a mutually beneficial relationship for years, that may be renewed whenever convenient to both parties," the company said in a news release.
The agreement was seen as a heavy blow for Televisa, as Unilever is one of the 15 biggest companies in the world, and has one of the 10 largest advertising budgets in Mexico.
"The decision was taken after a thorough analysis of Unilever's market strategy," the news release added.

Unilever has traditionally awarded its Television advertising contract to Televisa. TV Azteca has been gradually taking viewers and advertising revenue away from Televisa since it was privatized in 1993.
